snippet: Nature is firing a shot across our bow to direct our attention to the asteroids that make up the near-Earth object population. We should take the warning seriously.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Donald K Yeomans, senior research scientist and manager of Near-Earth Object Program Office at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, contends that asteroid that will pass near earth on Feb 15 is a warning about more than two dozen others that have chance of striking earth; calls on NASA and its domestic and international partners to redouble search for near-Earth objects with more powerful telescopes.
lead_paragraph: Nature is firing a shot across our bow to direct our attention to the asteroids that make up the near-Earth object population. We should take the warning seriously.
